# automaticallyAdjustsContentInsets

**Instance Property**

A Boolean that indicates whether the scroll view automatically adjusts its content insets.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var automaticallyAdjustsContentInsets: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

When the value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the scroll view automatically sets its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView/contentInsets] property to account for any overlapping title or tool bar. To overlap with the title or tool bar, the window style mask must include `NSFullSizeContentViewWindowMask` and the title bar must not be transparent.

The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

## Managing Insets

- **contentInsets**: The distance that the scroll view’s subviews are inset from the enclosing scroll view during tiling.
- **scrollerInsets**: The distance the scrollers are inset from the edge of the scroll view.
